review:
LOVE 2: kuso es un juego minimalista de plataformas que cumple sobradamente con su cometido: entretener. Dispone de los 16 niveles que aparecían en la primera entrega de la saga, a los cuales se han añadido 25 niveles nuevos y otros cuantos niveles de la primera entrega, pero mejorados (LOVE+).
Gráficamente es minimalista, pixelado al máximo y con un aire retro genial y premeditado. Además, mejora notablemente el aspecto de la primera entrega, con mayor detalle en los decorados, más colores en su paleta, y muchos más secretos por descubrir.
La banda sonora, como ya ocurría en su antecesor, tiene un aire tecno que, aunque trepidante, no me acaba de convencer. Simplemente cumple.
La jugabilidad es brillante, con un control suave y preciso que no dará lugar a dudas. Si fallas en tal o cual salto será porque has cometido un error, no por la falta de precisión en la programación. En este tipo de juegos de habilidad plataformera, esto es un punto muy importante a su favor.
La dificultad está bien ajustada, sin llegar a ser extremadamente frustrante pero que requerirá de toda tu habilidad para ir avanzando sin perder demasiadas vidas. Muy bien calibrada en general.
La durabilidad no es excesiva, de alrededor de 10 horas si pretendes conseguir todos los logros. Las modalidades de juego son variadas, con arcade, speedrun, YOLO y alguna más que prolongarán la vida del título y a las cuales se suma el reto de intentar estar entre los mejores highscores mundiales.
En definitiva, si te gustó el primer juego de la saga, o si te gustan los juegos de habilidad plataformera, éste es un título muy recomendable.

NOTA: 7/10

review: Ok, first thing's first: BUY THIS GAME. No matter your skill level or platformer literacy, you'll definitely get a kick out of this. LOVE 2: kuso is now obsolete as LOVE 3 released and contains the LOVE and kuso campaigns. In any case, my impressions of kuso:

A clear strong improvement over he already fun LOVE, this is an 8-bit precision platformer with tight controls, a banger of a soundtrack and surprisingly enjoyable visuals.

review:
To krótka, ale trudna platformówka. Gra nie toleruje żadnych błędów i wymaga sporej precyzji, co przy bardzo szybko rozpędzającej się postaci może sprawiać trudności. Z pomocą przychodzi ciekawy system checkpointów - sami stawiamy je w dowolnych miejscach, bez ograniczeń. Jedyną granicą jest ilość żyć, zależna od trybu. Możemy mieć ich nieskończoność, 100 lub tylko jedno(Yolo Mode). Po utracie wszystkich zaczynamy całość od nowa, nie ma czegoś takiego jak save.

To samo co wyżej pisałem o jedynce, bo to się mocno nie różni od niej. A nawet zawiera wszystkie poziomy z poprzedniczki, więc można zacząć od kuso.

Minimalistyczne, z prostymi zasadami, ale wcale nie proste. Do tego z naprawdę świetną muzyką w tle.

review:
My best pitch for Love 2 is that it's a precision platformer with not only solid fundamentals, but is also accessible to all by proving a lot of player freedom in terms of difficulty. By solid fundamentals, I mean the jumping feels great; the levels fit your range of motion and are varied and interesting. By accessible, I mean that due to the ability to set check points anywhere, you can still have fun with it if you 1) aren't great at platformers 2) is not in the mood for the stressfulness of other precision platformers. In fact, the combination of relaxing music, smooth movement, relaxing music, Love 2 was actually a great de-stress game for me. 

One question I had before going into the game is how the dev will provide a baseline challenge for the game to be interesting. The answer is actually quite simple, you can only set check points at a safe place. This means that the dev can still increase the challenge by spacing out safe areas..

P.s., This game also includes all of Love 1's the levels. It's still a short game if you don't want to dive into the speed run / limited life modes, but I thought it was well-worth the money.

review:
LOVE 2: kuso is the sequel to the highly underrated (in my opinion) LOVE, so let's dive into the sequel. Since there's no story we're jumping straight into graphics.

Graphics:

Just like LOVE, the sequel follows on a very minimalistic, Atari 2600 style of graphics and again it nails this aesthetic perfectly. Each level looks distinct and fresh enough, but I felt the levels overall weren't as weird as they were in the first, but they still got grander as they went along which some of these levels looked pretty impressive. 

Audio:

LOVE had an absolutely outstanding soundtrack, that to this day I sometimes go back and listen to a few of the tracks, just because of how good they were. I was really looking forward to listening the soundtrack to 2, and while I didn't like it as much as the first one, I felt that the tracklist was great. 

There's plenty of tracks that mixed with the trippy visuals make for quite the experience and even though I hated the soundtrack at first, I grew to love it over time, but I still prefer the first ones soundtrack, but just barely. There's almost no other sound effects, only a few low quality thud noises when something impacts with the ground.

Gameplay:

LOVE 2: kuso is almost identical gameplay wise with the original Love. You go around each level trying to go from point A to B while trying not to die. You can place your own checkpoints whenever you get past an incredibly difficult platforming section, which helps for players wanting a more casual experience.

There's also plenty of different modes like speedrunning modes and even including the first game for free, not to mention the ability to play them both together tied together, which is absolutely amazing. I will say the game is also much more difficult than the first one. I felt the first one was pretty easy for the most part, which only a few really difficult sections, however a lot of the levels in LOVE 2 were much harder which gave me trouble.

The controls just like the first game are really tight and I feel like I always was at fault whenever I died, however I will say the level design isn't as good as the first one, with some levels having some insanely tight platforming that I found quite annoying. 

Verdict:

As I said before, I loved LOVE (pun intended) and LOVE 2: kuso is just more of that, so there's nothing to hate. I highly recommend this if you want a minimalistic platformer that's both short and sweet. If you do intend to buy this, I highly urge you to buy the first one as well to support the developer as I think he definitely deserves the support.

Final Rating:
8.5/10

Pros:
+ Great soundtrack
+ Tight and fun platforming
+ Nice visual style
+ Tons of game modes for different types of players

Cons:
- Level design is not as good as the first one

review:
This is the definition of a hidden gem.

kuso is a platforming game that's challenging, but not unfair in the slightest. Not to mention, you can really make it as hard or easy as you want. On my first run, I used tons of checkpoints and died loads of times, and got an F grade. There isn't really much that incentivizes you to play again besides just wanting a higher grade. The full game is relatively short, but I haven't even tried most of the modes, which I plan on doing. Honestly, for $5, I don't really see how you could go wrong with this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064297907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1552682605}
review:
Whoa, the unassuming first impression aside, this adds to the masocore platforming genre in super smart (and subtle ways). Most notably, the way your death has about 25 animation / sound effect variations confirms a sense of varied outcome, even if you're trying the same problem in the exact same way. This amplifies your sense of "there's a way through this" even if you're not sure what you're doing wrong. It's subtle. But genius.

The other thing I'm adoring so far is the player-driven checkpointing. I can drop a respawn point wherever I want—even if its quite unsafe still. The big risk-reward of that placement is that if a death-dealing object can hit the checkpoint I dropped, I'm tossed back to the level start. So the risk is high, but it keeps all the control in my hands, maximizing my sense of agency. 

In short, this might look simple, but the underlying depth is enormous.

review:
[h1]A LOVEly platformer.[/h1]
Like LOVE, [b]kuso[/b] is a twitch-based platformer that is as easy or challenging as you want to make it.

[h1]Checkboxes![/h1]
[b]My acquisition:[/b] ☑ Bought on Steam - ☐ Humble Bundle - ☐ Gift - ☐ Other

[b]Did I beat it?[/b] ☑ Yes - ☐ No

[b]Audience:[/b] ☐ Kids - ☑ Everyone - ☐ Casual players - ☐ Pro players

[b]Graphics:[/b] ☐ Potato - ☐ Bad - ☐ OK - ☑ Good - ☐ Beautiful

[b]Audio:[/b] ☐ Mute it - ☐ Bad - ☐ OK - ☑ Good - ☐ Beautiful

[b]Story Quality:[/b] ☑ N/A - ☐ Bad - ☐ Average - ☐ Good - ☐ Fantastic

[b]Controls:[/b] ☐ Bad - ☐ Acceptable - ☐ Good - ☑ Fantastic

[b]Stability:[/b] ☐ Buggy mess - ☐ Some non-game breaking bugs - ☐ Almost perfect - ☑ Stable

[b]Difficulty:[/b] ☐ Too easy - ☐ Easy - ☑ Challenging - ☐ Challenging+ - ☐ Cruel!

[b]When to buy:[/b] ☐ Full price - ☑ Wait for sale - ☐ Never

[b]Requirements:[/b] ☑ Minimal - ☐ Medium - ☐ High end - ☐ Dangerously high

[b]Others:[/b] ☐ Multiplayer - ☑ Single player

[h1]Conclusion/notes:[/h1]
[b]kuso[/b]'s main gimmick is the ability to set your respawn point wherever you want. Set it just before or just after a difficult jump (or both!), and blaze through the levels quickly - or never set it at all, and challenge yourself to beat each level without dying. LOVE, this game's predecessor, was exactly the same - to the point that LOVE's levels are included in kuso. It's a very quick game (unless you get into perfecting each stage, or striving for a high score), but it's still an enjoyable experience.

[h1]Tl;dr:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Short, fast game.
[*] Excellent twitch-based platformer gameplay.
[*] Respawn system allows you to tweak the difficulty on-the-fly.
[/list]

review:
まず『kuso』というタイトルの由来について、[url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/578930/discussions/0/2479690531144800036/]Steamコミュニティの掲示板[/url]に書かれているが、制作者が80年代のゲームセンターで『ディグダグ』をプレイした人が、ミスした時に「クソッ！」と叫んでいるのを見て、この言葉には、失敗やうまくいかない状態を表現する「[b]frustration（要求不満・挫折）[/b]」の意味が含まれている事を知った、それにちなんでネーミングしたという。

つまり、タイトルの意味と本作のコンセプトは「[b]プレイヤーに『クソッ！』と言わせること[/b]」である。

[h1]☆高難易度対スピーディー、得られるものは「爽快感」[/h1]

映像は80年代PCを思い出すような荒いドット絵。この中で、トラップを避けながら出口に向かうのみという、極めてシンプルなルールのアクションゲームだ。

操作は左右移動とジャンプのみ、それに加え、ミスした時に戻される復活場所を配置できる「チェックポイント」ボタンが備わっている。
これを利用して、難しい場面の直前でポイントを設置すれば、同じ場面を何度でも繰り返し挑戦できる。しかも死んだ瞬間に次のプレイヤーがすぐ動き出す、待ち時間はほぼゼロだ。

ステージに仕掛けられたトラップは、延々とベルトコンベアのように流れていくもの、プレイヤーを狙い撃ちする砲台、出現と消滅を繰り返す床、1キャラクター分しかないギリギリの隙間に飛び込むなど、ジャンプするべき場所やタイミングはどれもシビアで容赦しない。

高難易度に対して、チェックポイント機能というシンプルかつスピーディーなシステムのおかげで、アクションゲームにおいての不満は限りなく削減されている。おかげで「クソッ！」の対象はゲームのトラップ、そしてミスしたプレイヤー自身のみとなる。

そして何度も挑戦すれば、流れゆく障害物のわずかな隙間に入り込んで突き進む、小さい足場を正確にジャンプして踏み越えながら狙い撃ちしてくる砲台の弾を次々と避けるなど、あたかも高難易度ゲームを[b]ノーミスでパーフェクトにクリアした[/b]かのような、達成感と爽快感を各場面ごとで味わうことができるだろう。この気持ち良さが『kuso』の醍醐味だ。

[h1]☆相手は「機械」である[/h1]

とは言っても、さすがに数十回～100回くらい死に続けると「進めない！やめた！」となる人もいるだろう。
そんな時は、トラップの動きをじっくりと見て欲しい。

障害物や砲台などはどれも「[b]一定の速度で規則正しく動く・変化する・狙い撃つ[/b]」のみで、変則的な動きでプレイヤーを騙す攻撃はない。
だから、どこかに通り抜けるタイミング「[b]トラップの隙間[/b]」が必ずある、それを見極めるまで何度も挑戦するしかないのだ。中には音楽のように決まったリズムで動くものもあるので、BGMを聞きながらタイミングを取るのも一つの方法だ。

ステージのあらゆるトラップに挑戦しろ、失敗したら「クソッ！」と叫べ、そしてまた挑戦しろ、何度も繰り返して「隙間」を見つけろ、その隙間を通り抜けて「クソッ！」を「成功」に結びつけろ。
そうやって、一定の速度で動き続ける機械的なトラップに人間が抗い続けた先に、クリアという勝利とパーフェクトで切り抜けたというと喜びを得る。

これが、ゲームに込められた「kuso」の真意だ。

review:
kuso to ulepszona wersja gry LOVE, staroszkolnej platformówki autorstwa Freda Wooda. Względem poprzedniczki kuso oferuje więcej poziomów, sekretów i działa w płynnych 60fps. 
Gameplay nie różni się względem poprzedniczki, w skrócie staramy się pokonywać przeróżne przeszkody przy okazji nie ginąc.
W grze znajdziemy aż 50 różnorodnych poziomów: 25 nowych i pomysłowych, 16 ulepszonych poziomów z pierwszej części LOVE oraz 9 bonusowych dostępnych wyłącznie z menu Level Select, każdy poziom jest całkiem dobrze zrealizowany i oferuje dostateczne wyzwanie.
Gra oferuje różne tryby rozgrywki jak Unlimited oferująca nieskończoną liczbę żyć, tryb stworzony z myślą o casual-owych i nowych graczach czy Arcade oferujący 125 żyć by przejść grę, niestety lub stety zabrakło tu trybu YOLO, na jego miejsce zaoferowano tryb Hard, w którym musimy ukończyć te szalone poziomy z 10 życiami + 8 dodatkowymi do znalezienia w trakcie gry. Mamy też tryb Speedrun, gdzie walczymy o jak najlepszy czas w rankingu, dodatkowym wyzwaniem tego trybu są zegary do zbierania, część zegarów jest umieszczona w sekretach. Ostatni tryb to Endless, w którym gra oferuje nam poziomy w losowej kolejności a my musimy pokonać jak najwięcej zdołamy mając do dyspozycji ograniczoną liczbę żyć.
Co do sekretów, w niektórych poziomach można znaleźć dobrze ukryte pomieszczenia, w których możemy zobaczyć coś ciekawego niż sama znajdźka. Jest też jeszcze jeden sekret w grze, ale ten polecam znaleźć samemu. Pojawia się też stary sekret w jednym z poziomów poprzedniczki.
Oprawa audiowizualna niewiele się zmieniła względem poprzedniczki, głównie znajdziemy tu nową i ulepszoną muzykę świetnie pasującą do tej gry.
Grze nie ma co zarzucić względem płynności i działania, sterowanie też daje radę.

No to podsumowanie:
Plusy:
+Świetny hardkorowy gameplay
+Genialna muzyka
+50 różnorodnych poziomów, pojawiają się nowe poziomy oraz stare, ale zremasterowane z LOVE, prequela kuso
+Prosta grafika w starym dobrym retro stylu
+Sekrety i znajdźki
+Wiele różnych trybów do wyboru
+Płynne i bezproblemowe działanie
+Perfekcyjnie zaprojektowane sterowanie
+Osiągnięcia i karty
+Cena adekwatna do tego co oferuje
Minusy:
-Brak edytora plansz, który zdecydowanie wydłużyłby żywotność gry i przyciągnął graczy na dłużej, gra się po prostu o niego aż prosi

kuso jest tym za co polubiłem LOVE i co niektóre rzeczy robi nawet lepiej, choć brakuje mu paru rzeczy to jest to dobra tania staroszkolna platformówka oferująca niezłe wyzwanie i dobra odskocznia od większych gier, więc jeżeli lubisz gry w stylu Super Meat Boy bądź grałeś w LOVE to polecam. Moja ocena to 9,5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122692491', 'num_games_owned': 1106, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1538065088}
review:
As this game is similar to LOVE (made by the same dev) I'll be copying most of my review from that. To cut a long story short with this review pick up the game as soon as you can, as it is well worth the price.

[h1]From my LOVE review:[/h1]
Don't be put off if you don't like a challenge, this game offers a lot for the price!

Gameplay is very simple with you jumping around levels trying to reach the end while avoiding obstacles, such as spikes and bottomless pits. Each level is perfectly crafted for the jumping mechanics, with enough challenge to keep you coming back for more!

Replayability is quite high, with especially good potential for speedrunning. With the superb level design and simple mechanics it makes for quite the fun speedrunning game!

The most subjective part is the pixel graphics, which I personally like the look of but I'm sure others will not agree with. I'd personally recommend looking past the graphics and focusing on the gameplay purely.

[b]TLDR:[/b] Buy when you can, it is worth it for what it offers in challenge and speedrunning.

review:
ジャンプと移動だけで障害を避けてゴールを目指していくゲーム。
全２５コースで難易度はそれなりに高め。
ゲーム性からアイワナを思い出させるが、任意の場所でセーブできることや初見殺しの理不尽トラップとかはないので難しいけどストレスフリー。
リトライも一瞬である。
各コースで違うBGMが流れるがどれも心地よいリズムの良BGM。
ゲーム内で音量調節はできないので音量ミキサーから調整しましょう。

プレイモードが複数あり、無制限に死ねるモード。
１２５の有限ライフでクリアを目指すモード。
ライフ１０のモード。
スピードランという左上にフレーム数を表示してくれるモードとあってやりこみ要素も十分。
おまけにコースを選んで苦手なコースだけ練習も出来るからやりこみの助けになるでしょう。
値段も非セール時でも５００円以下とお安いし十分楽しめる作品かと思います。



しかし、なぜタイトルがkusoなのだろう。
それだけが不思議でした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198824107435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1532421742}
review:
非常にシンプルな２Dジャンプアクションゲーム。欠点らしい欠点がなく、よくまとまっている。

・操作性が抜群。横移動は動き始め・停止ともに慣性がなくかなり鋭く動き、ジャンプはボタンを押す長さで高さを変えられるが大小２段階のみ。

・チェックポイント設置により、この手のゲームで苦痛となる（一方で醍醐味であるという意見もあるだろうが）戻し作業が実質必要ない。落下して大きく戻ってしまっても自殺でチェックポイントに戻れる点も嬉しい。

・ステージ構成が基本に忠実で理不尽さがない。序盤は１種類の障害物で当たり判定や周期を学ばせ、後半のステージではそれらを組み合わせた構成にすることで難易度をあげている。あくまで単純なものの組み合わせなのでパターンかも十分に可能と思われる。ちょっとした寄り道や近道が用意されているのも良い。

強いて欠点を挙げるなら低価格ゲームらしいボリュームの少なさ（それでも全２５ステージあり、私の場合無制限モードをクリアするのに１時間程度を要した）くらいか。だがそれもリスポーン回数制限モードやタイムアタックモード、そして実績の存在により気にならない。ついでにRTAにも向いてる。

review: kuso left me with pretty mixed feelings. In fact, I wasn't certain whether I wanted to write a positive or negative review about it. The reason of this is because kuso is the sequel to LOVE, a game that holds a special place in my heart. Personally, I feel that kuso did not live up to what LOVE did. The levels in these 2 games have a major difference. In LOVE the levels felt like something produced by pure inspiration which meant that they weren't neccesary difficult(Although most of them had their own challenge for the player). In kuso ,however, while there still is a spark of creativity, it's clear that the intention behind the levels was for them to be challenging. Both of the games are challenging, however kuso tries to focus on that aspect whereas LOVE focused more on creating something unique, something inspired. With all of that out of the way, the gameplay of kuso is just like the one in LOVE, but due to the different focus I mentioned, kuso is a greater challenge. I would recommend kuso to people that want a challenging 2d platformer and people that have played LOVE because while the focus is different, part of what made LOVE unique is still in there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282360169', 'num_games_owned': 5695, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1542424531}
review:
[h1]LOVE与KUSO，成双成对[/h1]
之前玩过第一作[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Kaoriorz/recommended/269270]LOVE[/url]，所以关注了第二作这款叫KUSO的游戏，因为近期打了折然后又因为拥有前作的关系加送了五折优惠券才绿了，看来又是要入包的节奏。

[list]
    [*]简介与操作
初见第一作的时候，先入为主把游戏想象成情感类的游戏，然而看了PV却并不是，玩了后根本跟标题没有半点关系；自然而然这一作的名字KUSO跟游戏内容没有半点关系。
两部作品都是像素风格的2D平台硬核跳跃游戏，作品发售顺序是LOVE在前面，然而开发商宣传的是“KUSO是LOVE的前传”这样子，在游戏内容上，都有互相不同的地方。
操作是一样的，左右键、跳跃键、设置重生点键、人生重来键，就是这样几个简单键位来游玩这款难得离谱的游戏。

游戏模式一共四种，根据小人拥有的生命数量分为三种：无限命模式、一般模式、困难模式，另外还有一个无限命的计时速跑模式。
关卡一共25个，每一个关卡色调、BGM、地图布置都很少重复。

    [*]继承与创新
复活点。本作的复活点不再可随时放置了，如果你的复活点被移动的攻击体打碎，那么死亡后小人就会从这一关的起点再来，不再像前作那样随便扔复活点（哪怕是设置一出生就会死亡的点），可以说难度加大了。

动态攻击。前作的攻击模式单一，基本都是有规律可循，移动的花粉，激光射线、小火球这些；但是本作却大胆做出创新，花粉的攻击是会追踪喷射的，中后期遇到大炮是会被追着打，逼着小人在前后的两个复活点设置处快速移动不容任何失误。

更多的陷阱。能看见只能踩一次就消失的小滑块；劈头盖脸下雨般的镭射圈；快速闪现的小平台；上下滑动的电柱等等。

音乐。一样的富有节奏感的8 BIT风味音乐，可以说音乐是本系列最值得称赞和推荐的地方。

困难。一样的难，同样会有一段长路无法安全存档，在操作上是不容半点失误，这次成就正常通关一个都没得解，因为是收集类和技术类成就。

[/list]

游戏时间在90分钟以内，我一共死了1200来次，评分都是F。
总的来说这是一场与前作体验不一样的[strike]作死[/strike]体验。

UPDATE:
I have finally beaten the game twice in Unlimited mode. Whew!

First run took 66 minutes.
And the second run around 40 minutes.

When you beat the game, the CREDITS is another level you can play which is very cool. The fact that the developer built another level for tutorial and CREDITS is very clever and took more work to do.

The effort that has been put to make all of this is very admirable.

I will play Arcade mode next. I think I'm ready.

Thanks for reading.

-----------------------------------------------

I don't know how I missed this game last year but I'm glad a friend recommended it to me.

Played and beat the first game LOVE and I loved it. The game's name fits.

Now I'm playing the sequel KUSO and boy...this game is 10x harder than before. I LOVE IT!

Like the previous game, KUSO has simple and responsive controls (you only need the D-pad and 3 buttons, that's it).

Fred Wood has taken the level design to the next level. Every element in this game such as platforms, background, objects, timing and difficulty are cleverly designed.

The awesome soundtrack fits the different levels.

Although the game is already simple enough to learn, the short intro tutorial makes you even more comfortable to start playing.

The game is hard but fair. You only die because of your own mistake.

I haven't beaten the game yet but I'm always excited to come back.

This is a great game to relax. I hope the developer makes a third title.

When playing KUSO, you can feel the game was created with the developer's heart.

This is easily one of the best platformers out there.

Thank you for making this wonderful game.

review:
The minimalistic aesthetic combined with old-school challenging platforming brings me back to a more primitive technological age, when the hum of CRTs and piezoelectric buzzers accompanied playing games like Janitor Joe and a bootleg PC port of Mario Bros (using ASCII characters in place of Mario, Luigi, and the enemies).

kuso's challenge isn't frustratingly hard, since it's very obvious that it's all possible; you just need to figure out the timing.

The music is phenomenal and is tailored to each level perfectly.

All-in-all, I highly recommend picking up kuso, especially if you grew up playing platformers in the PC-DOS era.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006575550', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 625, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1520184122}
review:
Kuso is something I completely missed last year and it seems like so did a lot of other people. I say, don’t do that! Especially if you like fairly difficult platformers that require a lot of skill to complete. My first time through I had 366 deaths, it was nuts!

It's cool that the game lets you set your own respawn point until you forget and you have to go all the way back to the start. If the respawn point is destroyed and then you die you’ll be forced all the way to the start. I have much shame because of how many times I’ve done this. Arcade is probably the mode you’re supposed to play on and the game gives you 125 lives to finish. It’s a lot easier said than done. My first time through arcade I made it eighty percent through so it’s entirely possible which means they nailed the difficultly. The game is difficult without being impossible. This isn’t "Getting Over It" levels of frustration. Kuso is a nice gentle anger from knowing that life you just lost was really dumb and good luck finishing now, you’re bad. You know what I mean?

My favorite part is that they have a different music track for each level. I know that's a weird thing to love about a game but it shows how much care and effort went into crafting Kuso. No one has to do that, looping music would have worked. The music is fantastic too and there are times you might not want to leave the level because it's so good.

With great level design and an amazing soundtrack. I recommend this!

I made a video review: https://youtu.be/gM4ggmHIpL0

author: {'steamid': '76561198086510640', 'num_games_owned': 1938, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1644569783}
review:
【リスポーン可能な2Dアクションゲーム】

　心地よい電子サウンドが流れる中、各障害物を避けて飛び越えて、
　難しいなら手前で地点登録して乗り越え、次ステージを目指す2Dアクションゲーム

　・操作は単純、障害物は難関
　　　基本的に移動、ジャンプ、地点登録、地点まで戻る為の自殺のみの操作ですが、
　　　ちょんジャンプやリズムよく飛んで行ったり、小さい足場に乗る為のコントロールが必要など、
　　　難しい場所が多々あります。
　　　ただ、初見殺しの配置がなく、どれも手前に地点登録が可能な場所を用意してある為、
　　　直ぐに何度でも挑むことが出来ます。

　・操作はコントローラーがお勧め
　　　操作はキーボードだと、矢印キーで移動、文字とスペースキーでジャンプ、地点登録となる為、
　　　コントローラーがやりやすいかと思われます。
　
　・全25st+多数の実績(シークレットもあり)
　　　全25ステージあり、全てに色々な音楽が用意されている為、作者の作り込みを感じられる作品となっております。
　　　モードはアンリミテッド 機数無制限、アーケードモード 125機、ハード　１０機、
　　　タイムアタックとステージセレクトできるモードがあります。
　　　実績も多数ある等、金額も安いながらやり込める内容となっております。
　　　また、デモ版もある為、気になる方はそちらを手始めにプレイしてみるのもいいかもしれません。

　プレイして是非ともクソッ!もう一回って言って欲しいゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198068117932', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1515162488}
review:
Kuso é um jogo lançado para PC em novembro de 2017, pelo desenvolvedor conhecido como Fred Wood. O jogo é uma sequência do game chamado "Love", que assim como este jogo, se trata de um jogo indie de puzzle lembrando bastante alguns jogos clássicos do Atari.

Kuso é um jogo definitivamente MUITO simples. A gameplay de fundo já está resumindo muito do que o jogo é. Aqui, basicamente você é um pequeno personagem que tem que atravessar por diversos desafios, que claro, vão sempre se dificultando cada vez mais. Enquanto atravessa as diversar plataformas, você tem a habilidade de correr, pular e até mesmo criar um checkpoint para salvar o jogo no momento em que achar mais interessante.

Ideal para aqueles que gostam de jogos curtos, ou que gostam de jogar algo enquanto estão baixando um jogo ou coisa do tipo, em Kuso você pode chegar a concluir o jogo em até um pouco mais de uma hora, dependendo bastante do quão rápido e preciso você consegue ser. Após zerar, você também terá vários outros modos mais complexos, com limite de tempo ou vidas.

Com um level design bastante bem desenhado, o jogo se torna interessante para os fãs de jogos de plataforma que querem algo desafiante e rápido. Sem dúvidas, vale a pena, principalmente se o jogo estiver com desconto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997517073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1511598232}
review:
I appreciate KUSO very much.
I appreciate how it lets you just play the game how you'd like. KUSO is very hard, but it goes out of its way to be fair. You can create your own checkpoints, and you can make as many of them as you'd like. You can also fail as many times as you'd like, there is no limit. But then there are modes that DO limit your lives and checkpoints, if you feel like challenging yourself.
I really enjoy the way KUSO looks, though I do wish the environments had a bit more variety to them. Even with faux-retro graphics, you can tell a story purely by showing the world change a little bit as the game progresses. The last level of KUSO looks a lot like the previous levels, which also looks a lot like the developer's previous game, LOVE. It's not a bad look! But I hope he stretches his legs a bit in future titles.

review:
I don't really write reviews on games, but I figured I'd give credit where it's due for this smaller title.  Firstly, I bought this game mostly for the sound track after seeing it briefly played on stream and seeing that there is a bundle for a marginal cost that includes the sound track.  

That said, I gave the game a try and it's a total blast.  It's a very smooth old school platformer that let's you take on as much challenge as you desire.  On my first playthrough I died 400 times but the smooth tunes and the checkpoint system kept me from getting frustrated, as I tend to get on difficult platformers.  Next I tried Arcade mode which limits you to 125 lives; I tried this on my second playthrough and finish with a scant 8 lives.  The "hard" setting only gives you 10 lives, so good luck with that! In order to practice, it also allows you to pick any of the levels and just run through them to your heart's content.   

In short, really well put together.  As tough as you want it to be.  Excellent sound track.

review:
[h1]kuso – вторая игра от разработчика LOVE Фреда Вуда [/h1]

Фред Вуд анонсировал  kuso ещё 15 января 2017 года и вот, спустя 296 дней игра вышла в релиз 7 ноября 2017 года. Цена на данную игру составляет 2.99$ в странах СНГ и 130 рублей на территории России.

[list]

[*] Давненько мы не видели хорошо проработанный, сбалансированный платформер. Предшественница kuso была тоже хороша, но в kuso разработчик всё довёл до ума и теперь в это действительно приятно играть. 
Всего в игре около двадцати уровней и они обычно не больше одного экрана. У меня первое прохождение заняло 50 минут с 800 смертями, 2048 прыжками и около 500 чекпоинтов. Не долго, но это компенсируется несколькими режимами прохождениями: Безлимитный, в котором бесконечно жизней; казуальный, в котором вы сможете умереть 120 раз; режим спидраннера, который даст вам счётчик и бесконечно жизней.
Впрочем это всё что можно сказать об игре. Она весёлая, подойдёт для стрима, для нескольких прохождений, для спидрана. Не более.

[/list]

Вердикт:[i] короткий, удобный, честный платформер. Игра подойдёт всем любителям попрыгать.[/i]

Оценка: [b]7/10[/b]. Твёрдое похвально.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155668134', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1685834979}
review:
kuso, contrary to it's name, is not a kuso game. But as intended, it will probably make you curse under your breath as you try to complete the game in anything other than the unlimited-checkpoint mode.

This game is hard, but it's the right kind of difficulty - fair and telegraphed. It's a precision platformer with simple and intuitive controls - you just run and jump, and time your movement over many different obstacles. It's a relatively short game, but it is longer and more difficult than its predecessor, Love, which is the game that made me excited to get kuso in the first place.

The music is good: like seriously, this lo-fi track https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_kh42huPe78 featured in the trailer for the first game is excellent and really helped me get interested in buying the game, and after knowing that the soundtrack held up throughout all the levels, I knew it would be a great feature of kuso as well. The music really supplements the experience of playing these games, with their flat black backgrounds but detailed pixelated art, and difficult platforming gameplay that both scare you into making a mistake or put you into a sort of zen state as you concentrate through playing carefully.

I just really appreciate the design of these types of games: simple and self-contained with fluid controls, difficult enough to be engaging but forgiving enough and with enough difficulty options so as not to overwhelm the player, and it's like.... the game is really a work of art. WIth a game like this that doesn't have story or too many human-world elements, there's a focus on becoming immersed in the game's style, music, and gameplay, and that's what makes it feel like a real piece of art.

I don't often write reviews, but I'm writing one because I feel that simple, well-designed games like this deserve more recognition. Anyways, hope you guys enjoy the game and have a nice day!

I do plan on going back in and attempting the other modes -- one giving you 125 lives (I died roughly 200+ times) and one that gives you 10 -- which seems INSANE. 

I highly recommend this game. And before I hit submit, I just want to commend the dev for a great game and also an amazing soundtrack. I love every song included throughout. Easily one of the best soundtracks I have heard in 2017.

If you've played LOVE before, then you should really try this game. kuso has a lot of different places from LOVE. 

Most obvious changes include: 
a. Your respawn could be "killed" now, so you could no longer pass the level by keeping pressing S. (Though I think it is a kind of the gameplay...) 
b. You cannot jump on the booster now. Oh no. 
c. The whole game seems more "fluent" than LOVE... you know, this game boasts a "futuristic", but not "classic" style.
d. We have 25 levels now! Though they are not so unique between each other (which is different from LOVE, playing LOVE is like seeking a fantastic world), you can still enjoy jumping and timing.

First try with "Easy mode" cost me 57 mins, and I died 901 times... (you can even watch 901 little guys falling into the trap one after another when you complete all levels, XD) Anyway, just download it and enjoy a whole new trip!

Another fantastic game from the brain (and notebook) of Fred Wood! I've been following this for a while after loving his previous game, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/269270/LOVE/]LOVE[/url].
The platforming control is fantastic once again, and there is a cool grading system at the end of the game that reminds you how many times you died throughout.
And to top it all off, the soundtrack, once again by James Bennett is superb and complements the gameplay very well.

This is a great game whether you played and enjoyed LOVE as I did, or entered into the series through this game.
